intro: Viola senecta, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy violet or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. Viola senecta is often found in woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
